Iron Heart in Antlan Subs
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance Archive (GameBoy Advance): Shrine Topics: Iron Heart in Antlan Subs
By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, October 16, 2002 - 01:06 pm:

I will admit right off that I have not tried every possible letter combination yet, however, so far I have shrined over 20 monsters and they follow this pattern:

If you use a 3 letter password, and the second and third characters are "ow", in that order, you will get and Atlan sub (we aleady knew about the subs part from prior work), and it will have "Iron Heart".

Adding a character, or a space from the board, after the first three, will often make an Antlan sub, but the "Iron Heart" will be gone.

It's just one more small clue about the shrine formula.

By Sensei Le Roof on Saturday, March 11, 2006 - 04:26 pm:

Interesting. Have you tried any other such combinations? If not, I may look into it along with my own experiments.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, March 13, 2006 - 04:53 am:

Sorry, never got around to doing a lot of testing on this. IIRC, MR3 tournaments were taking up a lot of our time at that point in history.

By Sensei Le Roof on Monday, March 13, 2006 - 02:27 pm:

I'll have to play around with it then. ^_^

By Sensei Le Roof on Friday, March 17, 2006 - 10:58 am:

The Study Continues!

Check this out:
PasswordMainSubPOWINTACCSPDDEFLIFTraits
A^^SuezoOctopee1291551361009996Act. View, Water Know
B^^PsirollerOctopee144759612589126Earth Know, Water Know
C^^MocchiOctopee109115141135139121Soft Body, Water Know
D^^DuckenOctopee991259114013481Elec-proof, Water Know
E^^TigerOctopee1291101511708996Elec Resis, Water Know
F^^Octopee-12411013112084106Water Know
G^^AntlanOctopee14485116100139101Hard Skin, Water Know
^^^PsirollerOctopee144759612589126Earth Know, Water Know
`^^TigerOctopee1291101511708996Elec Resis, Water Know
+^^TigerOctopee1291101511708996Elec Resis, Water Know
@^^MocchiOctopee109115141135139121Soft Body, Water Know
&^^Octopee-12411013112084106Water Know
[^^MewOctopee12411513613594101Loud Voice, Water Know
]^^GolemOctopee179857155159111Rock Skin, Water Know
\^^MomoOctopee109801461659491Wind Resis, Water Know

Password key:
` = space
^ = 8th note
@ = small circle
& = weird blob by small circle
[ = Japanese quote (opening)
] = Japanese quote (closing)
\ = centered dot

They all have the Octopee sub and Water Know (which I believe is Octopee's inherent trait, right?). Not only that, but all occurrences of the same main type have the same stats.

I went a step further and tested a number of passwords that matched first and third characters...

[1]Momo-99811471489081Wind Resis, Footwork
[2]ZuumMew1458813413697114Flex Tail, Loud Voice, Footwork
[3]Arrow HeadTiger1241111078317581Hard Shell, Elec Resis, Footwork
[4]GolemPsiroller171627765149102Rock Skin, Earth Know, Footwork
[5]ZuumMogi13980150146106100Flex Tail, Footwork
[u]DuckenDurahan1061309615114588Elec-proof, Armor, Footwork

They all have Footwork. But when I played around some more...

[+]Lesione-11411298105108148Watr Resis
[\]Lesione-10813210199127141Watr Resis
[^]SuezoMogi12017510810590100Act. View
[@]Suezo-13415714010593113Act. View
[&]PixieMocchi861911331605582Soft Smell, Footwork

This time, only the last one has it. That may be because there's a programmed inability for Lesiones and Suezos to have Footwork, which makes sense since they don't have feet.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, March 17, 2006 - 04:51 pm:

Good research! Thanks!

By Sensei Le Roof on Sunday, March 19, 2006 - 06:27 am:

One interesting point I forgot to mention is that the main type granted by the first character (in the initial tests) is not the same as they type of monster given by that same character as a 1-length password.

By Sensei Le Roof on Tuesday, March 21, 2006 - 09:25 am:

I just did some number-crunching, running with the assumption that the single-character passwords provide baseline stats. All of those 3-letter passwords ending with two 8th notes provide +9 POW/DEF, +5 INT/SPD, +6 ACC and +1 LIF from the baseline stats.
